com.sap.conn.jco.ms

Interface JCoApplicationServer


  • public interface JCoApplicationServer
    Contains technical information about an application server of an ABAP system. The data is retrieved whenever JCoMessageServer.refresh() is executed.
    Since:
    JCo 3.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getGatewayServiceName()
      Returns the gateway service name.
      String getGatewayServicePort()
      Returns the gateway port number.
      String getGatewaySncServiceName()
      Returns the gateway service name used for SNC connections.
      String getGatewaySncServicePort()
      Returns the gateway port number used for SNC connections.
      String getHostName() 
      String getInstanceNumber()
      Returns the instance number of the application server.
      JCoMessageServer getMessageServer()
      Returns the JCoMessageServer instance the application server belongs to.
      String getName()
      Returns the application server name within the ABAP system.
      String getSapServices()
      Returns the list of SAP services provided by the application server.
      String getSncName()
      Returns the SNC name of the application server.
      String getTargetHost() 

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageServer

        JCoMessageServer getMessageServer()
        Returns the JCoMessageServer instance the application server belongs to.
        Returns:
        the JCoMessageServer instance the application server belongs to.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the application server name within the ABAP system. Also known as instance name. Name is <hostnameWithoutDomain>_<systemID>_<instance_number>
        Returns:
        the application server name within the ABAP system.

      • getInstanceNumber

        String getInstanceNumber()
        Returns the instance number of the application server. This value is often also referenced as system number, in particular also in the configuration of JCoDestination, as in most systems all instances have the same instance number.
        Returns:
        the instance number of the application server.

      • getHostName

        String getHostName()
        Returns:
        the host name of the application server without any further specified domain.

      • getTargetHost

        String getTargetHost()
        Returns:
        the fully qualified host name of the application server. This is the one, under which the message server knows the application server. If the system does not provide the feature of returning a fully qualified host name, the IP address is returned.

      • getGatewayServiceName

        String getGatewayServiceName()
        Returns the gateway service name. This is the default logical port defined in /etc/services, which is sapgw<instanceNumber>
        Returns:
        the gateway service name.

      • getGatewayServicePort

        String getGatewayServicePort()
        Returns the gateway port number.
        Returns:
        the gateway port number.

      • getGatewaySncServiceName

        String getGatewaySncServiceName()
        Returns the gateway service name used for SNC connections. This is the default logical port for SNC connections defined in /etc/services, which is sapgw<instanceNumber>s. If SNC is not enabled for the application server, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the gateway service name used for SNC connections.

      • getGatewaySncServicePort

        String getGatewaySncServicePort()
        Returns the gateway port number used for SNC connections. If SNC is not enabled for the application server, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the gateway port number used for SNC connections.

      • getSapServices

        String getSapServices()
        Returns the list of SAP services provided by the application server. The entries are separated by blanks. An incomplete list is: DIA (Dialog work processes), VMC (Virtual Machine Container), ICM (Internet Communication Manager), ENQ (Enqueue server), BTC (Batch processing).
        Returns:
        the list of SAP services provided by the application server.

      • getSncName

        String getSncName()
        Returns the SNC name of the application server. The format of the name depends on the implementation used for the application server. If SNC is not enabled for the application server, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the SNC name of the application server
